result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Possession of a Controlled Substance on or near Certain Places

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nora Christine Saldana

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: - Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

12:54 PM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Nora Christine Saldana. Defendant Nora Christine Saldana in court, in custody. DE confirms address and DOB. DE understands charges and possible penalties. Waive reading. DE does qualify for PD. Enter NG plea. Bond argument. Court orders bond. Atty Becker notes DE is awaiting Extradition to MN. Court sets PSC with Branch 1 for scheduling only. Adjourned.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on December 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
